title: There’s Apparently A Leopard In This Photo & I’ve Lost My Fucking Mind Trying To Find It
text:
The internet is going crazy today over an adult-level Where’s Wally picture that people are convinced has a leopard in it, according to the Daily Mail.

Twitter user Bella Lack shared the photo on September 27, asking if her followers could find the leopard in the image. She also confessed that she thought it was a joke until she eventually spotted the predator.

The picture, taken by her photographer friend in India, looks like a very boring image of a tree and some dirt, but it turns out there’s actually an apex predator sitting pretty almost front-and-centre in the shot.

Someone just sent this to me and asked me to find the leopard. I was convinced it was a joke… until I found the leopard. Can you spot it? pic.twitter.com/hm8ASroFAo — Bella Lack ???? (@BellaLack) September 27, 2019

Since the image was first posted, it has amassed a whopping 4.1k likes and 1.3k retweets, as well as countless replies from people that are convinced the animal doesn’t actually exist in the image.

Although leopard print is a very *extra* fashion trend for humans, it’s quite the contrary for the animals themselves. Their impressive spots basically allow them to disappear in plain sight in rocky and dry terrain.

The tweet also prompted a plethora of other “spot the leopard in the rocky cliffs” photos. Honestly, it’s like your very own Where’s Wally book.

When followers first started spotting the beast, other users were convinced it was some sort of inside joke and that the picture was just a bunch of rocks. However, some wonderful people later dropped spoilers in the reply to point it out to those of us who should’ve gone to Specsavers.

But even when circled in a big red marker, this sneaky leopard is still near impossible to find. It took a helpful internet stranger literally outlining the animal for some of us to be able to see it.

The post was also a reminder that leopards are the masters of camouflage, which would be slightly terrifying if you ever found yourself coming face to well, pile of rocks, with one in the wild.

If you aren’t prepared to spend hours trying to find this fucking leopard like I definitely did, you can find the glaringly obvious spoiler in the replies and at the bottom of this story for those of you who require instant gratification.
description: Twitter user Bella Lack has gone viral after sharing a photo that apparently contains a leopard. But the internet can't seem to spot him.
